titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King, Nancy Lyon, and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:51

did.unittitle: Zambia collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of printed material and photographs relating to political, economic, and social conditions in Zambia.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Zambia Collection (MS 1550). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection (MS 605); Pamphlet Collection (MS 1351); African Postcard Collection (MS 1575). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in this collection is arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of printed material and photographs relating to political, economic, and social conditions in Zambia.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Original Accession
Papers relating to mining and geological exploration, collected by C. V. Brennan
"Reports of Secretaries and Members to Accompany His Excellency the Governor's Address to Legislative Council," government of Northern Rhodesia

unittitle.title: The Crested Crane: Journal of the Northern Rhodesia Regiment

did.unittitle: "Northern Rhodesia (Africa) News Survey"
United National Independence Party (UNIP): press statements, policy statements, booklets, printed materials
"Independence?: A Framework for Economic Progress in Northern Rhodesia," the Phoenix Group
Election of 1962: pamphlets, election rolls, tables
Northern Rhodesia Liberal Party: letters, pamphlets, printed materials
African National Congress (ANC): election manifestos
Kaunda, Kenneth D., first president of Zambia: speeches, biographies
News magazines
Zambia-The Moulding of a Nation , by Mike Faber, Africa Bureau
Student/youth organizations: magazines, newsletters, art journals
Mudenda, E. H. K., Minister of Foreign Affairs: statement to the UN General Assembly, address to the Afro-Arab Committee
Economic affairs/commerce: booklets, journals, newspapers
National Immunization Program: opening address of seminar
"The Customary Law of Succession," the Law Development Committee: working paper

unittitle.title: Workers' Voice: Official Journal of the Zambia Congress of Trade Unions (ZCTU)

did.unittitle: Lima : a magazine on agriculture; Moog International Cooperation
Government documents; reports; speeches
The One Party State and its Future , by Nephas Tembo, Kenneth Kaunda Foundation (KKF)
"Toward Freedom: A Progressive Perspective on World Events," United States publication
Newspapers (without political affiliations)
Movement for Multi-Party Democracy (MMD): manifesto
"Women for a Healthy Planet: Training of Trainers Workshop," Zambia Alliance of Women
Institute of Current World Affairs: newsletters
Travels and Reminiscences of a Native Commissioner in Northern Rhodesia and Tanganyika, Part II - Rhodesia [i.e., Northern Rhodesia], by Jordan E. Knowles
"Federation and Northern Rhodesia: The Facts": a booklet summarizing some of the benefits Northern Rhodesia has obtained from Federation
United Federal Party (UFP): policy statement, printed materials
"You have been warned": pamphlet against UNIP by unidentified source
"Cooper Exploration of Northern Rhodesia," photographs by Percy W. Donovan
Photographs by the water: fishing, boating, cooking scenes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of printed materials of Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs).
